title.narrative: 1.9 EVIDENCE AND POLICY

description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygieneespecially for the most deprived communities
Proportion of UNICEF supported HPDs reflecting >20% increase in budget allocation from the previous year (Revised indicator No. 1 in June 2014)

actual.value: 2015:100 per cent (105/105) of HPDs have reflected more than 20% increase in the budget allocation compared to the previous year. District PIPs have been submitted by the states to GOI and the final allocation

title.narrative: Proportion of UNICEF supported HPDs with district gap analysis completed and monthly block monitoring initiated (Revised indicator No. 2 in June 2014)

actual.value: 2015:100%: The district gap analysis completed for 100% of the HPDs (105 /105). The findings have been shared with district , state and government of India and steps initiated in project implementation plans to address these gaps.

title.narrative: Number of state PIPs reflecting recommendations from district gap analysis / Block monitoring / SNCU monitoring / MDR / EVM assessment (Revised indicator No.3 in June 2014)

actual.value: 2015:15 out of 15 states: All the 15 state PIPs have incorporated the recommendations from DGA and block monitoring of their HPDs (15/15 states, 100%)

title.narrative: No. of states with Maternal Death Review & follow-up mechanisms in place using MDR software (Revised indicator No.4 in June 201)

actual.value: 2015:8 out of 15 states: Partnership established with AVNI to support capacity building and roll out of the same. Currently, the roll out of MDR software has taken place in 8 states namely AP, Telangana, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Bihar, Gujarat, and Assam. 1397 personnel trained in software.

title.narrative: Number of states with SNCU online monitoring system rolled out (New indicator added as No.5 in June 2014)

actual.value: 2015:8 out of 15 states: SNCU online monitoring system has been scaled up in 8 out of 15 states with UNICEF presence. As of now 45% SNCUs in the country ( 245 /548) are using the SNCU online monitoring system with regular data being entered and reports used for monitoring and guiding policy. The neces
